Long enough for Gaiman, then a promising comics writer and Duran Duran biographer, to become an industry: The Amazon Prime Video mini-series Good Omens, which debuted Friday, is the third current television show based on his work, with Netflixs Lucifer and Starzs American Gods.

title: Abortion Rights Groups See Northern Irelands Film Industry as Boycott Target
description: DUBLIN  Abortion rights activists scored a major victory this week when several major media companies said they would rethink filming in the state of Georgia if a newly passed restrictive abortion law there goes into effect.

title: What to Watch and Read if Youre Still Talking About the National Spelling Bee
description: An eight-way tie! This years National Spelling Bee crowned more champions than ever before, with auslaut, erysipelas and bougainvillea among the words they spelled correctly on Thursday.

title: Curbing Presidential Power, After Trump
description: To the Editor:

title: Baltimore Symphony Musicians Are Stunned After Concerts Are Canceled
description: For months, the management of the financially struggling Baltimore Symphony Orchestra has tried to negotiate cutting the number of weeks it pays its musicians to 40 weeks from 52. And its players have resisted, arguing that such a move would weaken the quality of the ensemble.

title: Some Enchanted Ending: Debuts and Other Spectacular Feats at City Ballet
description: The magic works fast. From the moment the first child-fairy flitters across the stage, pausing front and center to ripple her arms like tiny, trembling wings, the regenerative power of George Balanchines A Midsummer Nights Dream starts to take hold. Decent story ballets are hard to come by, but this New York City Ballet production, set to music by Felix Mendelssohn, has everything: humor, fantasy and spectacular dancing. Take anyone you know, of any age.

title: 3 of This Years Spelling Bee Winners Are Friends From Dallas
description: When students from the Dallas area took the stage for a regional spelling bee this spring, the competition was so intense that officials ran out of words, had to resort to a written test and, in the end, decided to send three top spellers to nationals.

title: Lawsuit Could Cool a Fast-Growing Way of Giving to Charities
description: When Emily and Malcolm Fairbairn decided to make a $100 million gift in 2017 to organizations that combat Lyme disease, they chose Fidelity Charitable, the countrys largest charity by assets, to distribute the money.

title: Its Going Great for Richard Madden. Thats What Worries Him
description: When it comes to award shows, always listen to Julianne Moore.

title: On Motherhood and This One Thing That People Dont Share
description: On a recent Friday afternoon, a stylish woman in her early 40s showed up at a Brooklyn podcasting studio to tape what was essentially a three-hour therapy session, which was to later be condensed and made available for the public to download.

title: The N.F.L. Has Been Consumed by the Concussion Issue. Why Hasnt the N.H.L.?
description: The day after Mothers Day was the eighth anniversary of the death of N.H.L. player Derek Boogaard. As usual, his mother, Joanne, spent a quiet day of reflection at home in Regina, Saskatchewan, and continued a tradition of writing a letter to her dead son to be published in the Regina Leader-Post.

title: A Basketball Homecoming for Canada
description: About an hour before the start of the N.B.A. finals on Thursday night, Commissioner Adam Silver arrived for his pregame news conference and offered a history lesson.

title: The Guests Youve Met Before
description: [Want to get this by email? Heres the sign-up.]

title: Choosing Whether or Not to Have a Baby
description: To the Editor:

title: Richard Prince and the New Meaning of High Art
description: SAN FRANCISCO  The large, brightly colored canvases sparkled beside the white walls of the Gagosian Gallery downtown. Larry Gagosian, the art worlds megadealer, stood toward the back of the room in blue jeans and loafers while the star of the evening, Richard Prince, the artist perhaps best known for tweaking iconic images and pushing the boundaries of intellectual property, stood reticently at the gallery entrance in a blazer and black Dr. Martens boots.

title: David Letterman 2.0, the Non-Ironic Version
description: On the first week of his original late-night talk show, David Letterman appeared on the streets of New York with a microphone in hand. Much has been said about Alan Alda, the TV star, the film star, the writer, the humanitarian, the champion of minority causes, he said in the grave voice of a 60 Minutes correspondent. But its surprising we dont know much about Alan Alda, the lover of Chinese food.

title: Complete List: Who Supports an Impeachment Inquiry Against Trump?
description: More than 90 percent of House Democrats now support impeachment proceedings.

title: Sarah Silverman Has Written a Musical
description: Most of us prefer to keep embarrassing adolescent stories to ourselves, but thats not Sarah Silvermans style. The comedian, actress and writer, who in 2010 shared her struggles with childhood incontinence in The Bedwetter: Stories of Courage, Redemption, and Pee, has turned the best-selling memoir into a musical that will debut as part of Atlantic Theater Companys coming season.

title: Its More Than Nostalgia for Roger Federer at the French Open
description: PARIS  It has been another year of big round numbers for Roger Federer. He won his 100th career singles title in Dubai in February. On Friday, on a luminous afternoon when springtime Paris felt like the place they used to write songs about, he became the first person in tennis history to play a 400th Grand Slam singles match.

title: Floods and Trumps Trade War Create an Uncertain Year for Farmers
description: Corn prices are rising as surging floodwaters and soaking rains  combined with President Trumps trade war with China  are making it an exceptionally difficult year for farmers facing risky choices about what crops to plant, or whether to plant at all.

title: Trade, Missouri, Spelling Bee: Your Friday Evening Briefing
description: (Want to get this briefing by email? Heres the sign-up.)

title: 12 Killed in Rampage at Municipal Center in Virginia
description: VIRGINIA BEACH, Va.  A municipal building in Virginia Beach, Va., was turned into a scene of carnage on Friday afternoon after a longtime public utilities employee began firing indiscriminately at his co-workers with a handgun, the authorities said, killing a dozen people and injuring several others before dying after an extended shootout with the police.

title: Secretive Bilderberg Meeting Draws Pompeo and Kushner
description: BERN, Switzerland  Secretary of State Mike Pompeo is on a weeklong trip to Europe where he is raising sensitive issues with national leaders  from Iranian missiles to Chinese technology to the economic collapse of Venezuela  but the most colorful conversations could take place this weekend out of public earshot in a secretive conclave at a Swiss lakeside resort.

title: Become My Mom Again: What Its Like to Grow Up Amid the Opioid Crisis
description: PORTSMOUTH, Ohio  Layla Keggs mother, back home after three weeks who knows where, says shes done with heroin, ready for rehab and wants to be part of her daughters life. But Layla has heard all of this before and doesnt believe a single word.

title: Trump to Kick Off His Re-election Campaign on June 18 in Orlando
description: WASHINGTON  On June 15, 2015, Donald J. Trump descended an escalator inside his signature Manhattan property, Trump Tower, greeted the cheering supporters paid to attend, and announced an unlikely presidential candidacy.

title: Marc Okkonen, Baseball Maven of a Sartorial Bent, Dies at 85
description: Marc Okkonen was watching the movie The Natural in 1984 when his attention shifted from its story of the mysterious slugger Roy Hobbs, played by Robert Redford, to the uniforms worn by Hobbss opponents onscreen.

title: Do You Use Chest Binders? Tell Us About Your Experience
description: A recent Times article on chest binding has incited a discussion among readers about the practice, which some transgender and gender-nonconforming people use to affirm their gender identity, and our coverage of it.

title: The Lessons of Paris and the Violence of Hope
description: PARIS  To be a Francophile is a life sentence. Its not exactly a badge of honor, not a burden either, but a slightly illicit gift of ever-renewed pleasures.

title: As China Takes Aim, Silicon Valley Braces for Pain
description: SAN FRANCISCO  When Silicon Valley looks west to China, it sees many things. More than a billion hungry consumers. A cheap source of labor. A competitor, partner, supplier and security risk.

title: Trump Threatens Tariffs on Mexico. Have Any of His Immigration Measures Worked?
description: President Trump has called for imposing tariffs on Mexico, the administrations latest attempt to slow the stream of migrant families who have been arriving at the southwest border by the thousands each day.

title: The Gravity Knife Led to Thousands of Questionable Arrests. Now Its Legal.
description: Over the past 60 years, tens of thousands of black and Latino New Yorkers have been arrested for carrying so-called gravity knives  small, easy-to-access blades that are used by everyone from stagehands to steelworkers.

title: When the Levees Break Again
description: NEW ORLEANS  Saturday is the official start of hurricane season. And the Army Corps of Engineers recently predicted that our levee system may soon be obsolete.

title: Memorial Tournament: Bud Cauley Makes a Stunning Comeback 1 Year After an Alarming Car Crash
description: DUBLIN, Ohio  Bud Cauley arrived in town Monday for the Memorial Tournament and was asleep in bed as the clock approached midnight. Thats where he wished he had been on the Friday of last years event, when he sustained serious injuries as a passenger in a late-night, single-car accident.

title: Ocasio-Cortez Went Back to Bartending. Slogans Were Served.
description: Officially, Representative Alexandria Ocasio-Cortezs one-hour return to her bartending days was about a push to raise pay for tipped-wage workers.

title: Frank Lucas Dies at 88; Drug Kingpin Depicted in American Gangster
description: As the Vietnam War raged in the late 1960s and early 70s, a potent heroin called Blue Magic flooded into Harlem and Newark from a mysterious Southeast Asian connection. It destroyed lives, and it turned a black gangster named Frank Lucas into one of Americas most notorious drug kingpins.

title: LaSalle Leffall Jr., 89, Dies; Cancer Societys First Black Leader
description: Dr. LaSalle D. Leffall Jr., a surgeon and educator who as the first black president of the American Cancer Society was a leader in promoting awareness of the risks of cancer, particularly among African-Americans, died on May 25 in Washington. He was 89.

title: Yankees Keep Rolling, Right Over the Red Sox
description: The fleeting moment has stuck with Aaron Boone. Last spring, in a spellbinding game at Yankee Stadium against the Boston Red Sox, third baseman Miguel Andujar turned to Boone, the Yankees manager, with the wonder of a rookie who had finally, truly made it.
